author: Intermountain Neuroimaging Consortium

DropNonSteadyState.description: set whether or not to remove XX number of inital non-steady state volumes. If no value is passed in 'DummyVolumes', non-steady state number is taken from mriqc IQMs, if neither are defined, an error will be returned.

DummyVolumes.description: Number of dummy volumes to ignore at the beginning of scan. Leave blank if you want to use the non-steady state volumes recorded in mriqc IQMs.

acompcor.description: (Default: False) Boolean flag to generate ACompCor confound regressors for input dataset.

outliers.description: (Default: False) Boolean flag to generate outlier spike regressors for input dataset. Outliers are computed based on framewise displacement (default: 0.5 mm) and standardized dvars threshold (default: 1.5). Set custom spike threshold using gear config settings fd-spike-threshold, dvars-spike-threshold. fMRIPrep's spike regressor method used for spike detection. Spike Regressors stored in confound file using prefix 'bids_confounds_outlier_XX'

gear-dry-run.description: Do everything except actually executing gear

gear-writable-dir.description: Gears expect to be able to write temporary files in /flywheel/v0/.  If this location is not writable (such as when running in Singularity), this path will be used instead.  fMRIPrep creates a large number of files so this disk space should be fast and local.

slurm-cpu.description: [SLURM] How many cpu-cores to request per command/task. This is used for the underlying '--cpus-per-task' option. If not running on HPC, then this flag is ignored

slurm-ram.description: [SLURM] How much RAM to request. This is used for the underlying '--mem-per-cpu' option. If not running on HPC, then this flag is ignored

slurm-ntasks.description: [SLURM] Total number of tasks/commands across all nodes (not equivalent to neuroimaging tasks). Using a value greater than 1 for code that has not been parallelized will not improve performance (and may break things).

slurm-nodes.description: [SLURM] How many HPC nodes to run on

slurm-partition.description: [SLURM] Blanca, Alpine, or Summit partitions can be entered

slurm-qos.description: [SLURM] For Blanca the QOS has a different meaning, ie blanca-ics vs blanca-ibg, etc. For Alpine and Summit, the QOS should be set to normal if running a job for 1 day or less, and set to long if running a job with a maximum walltime of 7 days

slurm-account.description: [SLURM] For Blanca the ACCOUNT should be set to the sub-account of choice (e.g. blanca-ics-rray). For Alpine, the account should be set to ucb-general, or the specialized account granted by RC: ucb278_asc1

slurm-time.description: [SLURM] Maximum walltime requested after which your job will be cancelled if it hasn't finished. Default to 1 day

description: (HPC Compatible) Flywheel gear to compute basic denoising timeseries regressors including Anatomical CompCor, rigid body head motion polynomials and derivatives, and outlier frames using fMRIPrep's SpikeRegressor method. Currently compatible with bids-hcp (>=v1.4), bids-fmriprep (all versions).

preprocessing-pipeline-zip.description: Select preprocessing directory zip. Preprocessing outputs must be in bids derivative format. Example compatible pipelines: fmriprep, hcppipeline

additional-input-one.description: (Optional) Additional preprocessing directory. Preprocessing outputs must be in bids derivative format.

label: BIDS Denoising: ACompCor and Outliers
name: bids-compcor
